description.narrative: During its activities, the NGO Agir Plus noted the great concern of the communities around the 2020 electoral issues. Indeed, the populations are reporting worrying situations surrounding the upcoming elections. For example, women and young people announce cases of purchases of voter cards, cases of intimidation and purchases of conscience, but also and above all in these concrete cases of young people who feel they have to obtain means of defense against of the atmosphere that is shaping up in the months to come. All this is happening in an environment where this time, the initiatives on the elections are absent in the region of Maradi or at least, are hardly noticeable. Faced with such an observation, the NGO Agir plus cannot remain inactive, given that the worst could call intoquestion its current project. For this, it will be necessary to work urgently to deconstruct certain behaviors and attitudes that are starting to create a climate of fear and discomfort among the women and young partners of the project. That is why the NGO Agir Plus is proposing this project to strengthen its contribution to the holding of participatory elections through information and education campaigns on the electoral process and on voter participation. More specificallyto: (1) Contribute to the sensitization and mobilization of the population at the regional level and enlighten them on the electoral process; (2) Promote voter participation in a democratic, moderate and peaceful manner.

participating-org.narrative: The NGO AGIR PLUS is a Nigerian Non Governmental Organization recognized by order of the Ministry of the Interior, Security, Decentralization and Religious Affairs No. 189 / MISD / AR / DGAPJ / DLP of 16 March 2011. Act More is apolitical, non-denominational and nonprofit. Active since 2010, the NGO Agir Plus supports the most vulnerable communities by encouraging innovative solutions for empowerment. Its creation comes at a time when Niger is ranked among the last on the planet on the human developmentindex. Convinced that the fight against poverty is a common task for all, the founding members of the NGO decided to make their contribution through concrete actions aimed at improving the living conditions of the most disadvantaged populations. The activities of the organization are structured around 05 programs namely: Food security and livelihoods Governance Education Health and Protection A vast youth program with 3 axes (Capacity Building and Networking - Advocacy - Youth Employment and Empowerment) Agir Plus has regional representations at the level of its intervention zones and departmental antennas. The NGO has 3 regional offices (Maradi Tahoua and Diffa) which coordinate the implementation of field activities. This allows the organization to be closer to local communities and actors. The national headquarters is based in Niamey and coordinates all activities at the internal level of the organization but also with stakeholders. At the level of intervention zones, Agir Plus develops excellent local relations with local actors (administrative and customary authorities, technical services, religious leaders, etc.). These relations are based on trust, accountability, transparency, ownership and ownership of all stakeholders in achieving project / program objectives. The NGO has 7 vehicles (three 4X4 and 4 pool vehicles) A dozen motorcycles. All the staff has a computer (34 PC - laptop) Furniture / office equipment (printers, photocopiers,etc.). The current partners of the NGO are amongothers the European Union, UNFPA (United Nations Population Fund), Belgian Technical Cooperation, US Embassy, SWISSAID, Counter Part International, SNV, Social Nets Cell, WHH, Haute Authority for Peace Consolidation, Ministry of Women's Empowerment and Protection of the Child, ect.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to social and political participation

description.narrative: Women and Men able to: # of people (M/F) living in poverty and injustice use their enhanced knowledge and skills to fullfill their rights on freedom of association, freedom of expression and to participate in public affairs.
